Armed Forces - military units equipped with weaponry for defense and combat.
Spigot - A valve or tap used for controlling water flow, often found on a garden hose or outdoor faucet.
Rabies - A viral disease transmitted through the saliva of infected animals, primarily dogs and bats, causing aggressive behavior in afflicted pets.
Carnival - An annual festival or event with feasting, entertainment, and various forms of celebration, often held before Lent in the Catholic Church.
